column1: indram īśānam ojasā abhi stomāḥ anūṣata sahasram yasya rātayaḥ uta vā santi bhūyasīḥ

column1: su samiddhaḥ naḥ ā vaha devān agne haviṣmate hotariti pāvaka yakṣi ca

column1: agne sukha tame rathe devān il̥itaḥ ā vaha asi hotā manuḥ hitaḥ

column1: ye pr̥ṣatībhiḥ r̥ṣṭi bhiḥ sākam vāśībhiḥ añji bhiḥ ajāyanta sva bhānavaḥ
column2: They who, self-luminous, were born together, with the spotted deer, Spears, swords, and glittering ornaments.

column1: iha iva śr̥ṇva eṣām kaśāḥ hasteṣu yat vadān ni yāman citram r̥ñjate
column2: One hears, as though 'twere close at hand, the cracking of the whips they hold They gather glory on their way.

column1: pra vaḥ śardhāya ghr̥ṣvaye tveṣa dyumnāya śuṣmiṇe devattam brahma gāyata
column2: Now sing ye forth the God-given hymn to your exultant Marut host, The fiercely-vigorous, the strong.

column1: pra śaṁsa goṣu aghnyam krīl̥am yat śardhaḥ mārutam jambhe rasasya vavr̥dhe
column2: Praise ye the Bull among the cows; for 'tis the Maruts' sportive band: It strengthened as it drank the rain.

column1: kaḥ vaḥ varṣiṣṭhaḥ ā naraḥ divaḥ ca gmaḥ ca dhūtayaḥ yat sīm antam na dhūnutha
column2: Who is your mightiest, Heroes, when, O shakers of the earth and heaven, Ye shake them like a garment's hem?

column1: ni vaḥ yāmāya mānuṣaḥ dadhre ugrāya manyave jihīta parvataḥ giriḥ
column2: At your approach man holds him down before the fury of your wrath: The rugged-jointed mountain yields.

column1: yeṣām ajmeṣu pr̥thivī jujurvān iva viśpatiḥ bhiyā yāmeṣu rejate
column2: They at whose racings forth the earth, like an age-weakened lord of men, Trembles in terror on their ways.

column1: sthiram hi jānam eṣām vayaḥ mātuḥ niḥ etave yat sīm anu dvitā śavaḥ
column2: Strong is their birth: vigour have they to issue from their Mother; strength, Yea, even twice enough, is theirs.

column1: ut oṁ iti tye sūnavaḥ giraḥ kāṣṭhāḥ ajmeṣu atnata vāśrāḥ abhi jñu yātave
column2: And these, the Sons, the Singers, in their racings have enlarged the bounds, So that the kine must walk knee-deep.

column1: tyam cit gha dīrgham pr̥thum mihaḥ napātam amr̥dhram pra cyavayanti yāma bhiḥ
column2: Before them, on the ways they go, they drop this offspring of the cloud, Long, broad, and inexhaustible.

column1: marutaḥ yat ha vaḥ balam janān acucyavītana girīn acucyavītana
column2: O Maruts, as your strength is great, so have ye cast men down on earth, So have ye made the mountains fall.

column1: yat ha yānti marutaḥ sam ha bruvate adhvan ā śr̥ṇoti kaḥ cit eṣām
column2: The while the Maruts pass along, they talk together on the way: Doth any hear them as they speak?

column1: pra yāta śībham āśubhiḥ santi kaṇveṣu vaḥ duvaḥ tatro iti su mādayādhvai
column2: Come quick with swift steeds, for ye have worshippers among Kaṇva's sons May you rejoice among them well.

column1: asti hi sma madāya vaḥ smasi sma vayam eṣām viśvam cit āyuḥ jīvase
column2: All is prepared for your delight. We are their servants evermore, To live as long as life may last.

column1: kat ha nūnam kadha priyaḥ pitā putram na hastayoḥ dadhidhve vr̥kta barhiṣaḥ
column2: WHAT now? When will ye take us by both hands, as a dear sire his son, Gods, for whom sacred grass is clipped?

column1: kva nūnam kat vaḥ artham gantā divaḥ na pr̥thivyāḥ kva vaḥ gāvaḥ na raṇyanti
column2: Now whither? To what goal of yours go ye in heaven, and not on earth? Where do your cows disport themselves?

column1: kva vaḥ sumnā navyāṁsi marutaḥ kva suvitā kva viśvāni saubhagā
column2: Where are your newest favours shown? Where, Maruts, your prosperity? Where all your high felicities?

column1: yat yūyam pr̥śni mātaraḥ martāsaḥ syātana stotā vaḥ amr̥taḥ syāt
column2: If, O ye Maruts, ye the Sons whom Pr̥iṣni bore, were mortal, and Immortal he who sings your praise.

column1: mā vaḥ mr̥gaḥ na yavase jaritā bhūt ajoṣyaḥ pathā yamasya gāt upa
column2: Then never were your praiser loathed like a wild beast in pasture-land, Nor should he go on Yama's path.

column1: mo iti su ṇaḥ parāparā niḥ r̥tiḥ duḥ hanā vadhīt padīṣṭa tr̥ṣṇayā saha
column2: Let not destructive plague on plague hard to be conquered, strike its down: Let each, with drought, depart from us.

column1: satyam tveṣāḥ ama vantaḥ dhanvam cit ā rudriyāsaḥ miham kr̥ṇvanti avātām
column2: Truly, they the fierce and mighty Sons of Rudra send their windless Rain e'en on the desert places.

column1: vāśrāiva vi dyut mimāti vatsam na mātā siṣakti yat eṣām vr̥ṣṭiḥ asarji
column2: Like a cow the lightning lows and follows, motherlike, her youngling, When their rain-flood hath been loosened.

column1: divā cit tamaḥ kr̥ṇvanti parjanyena uda vāhena yat pr̥thivīm vi undanti
column2: When they inundate the earth they spread forth darkness e'en in day time, With the water-laden rain-cloud.

column1: adha svanāt marutām viśvam ā sadma pārthivam arejanta pra mānuṣāḥ
column2: O Maruts, at your voice's sound this earthly habitation shakes, And each man reels who dwells therein.

column1: marutaḥ vīl̥upāṇi bhiḥ citrāḥ rodhasvatīḥ anu yāta īm akhidrayāma bhiḥ
column2: O Maruts, with your strong-hoofed steeds, unhindered in their courses, haste Along the bright embanked streams.

column1: sthirāḥ vaḥ santu nemayaḥ rathāḥ aśvāsaḥ eṣām su saṁskr̥tāḥ abhīśavaḥ
column2: Firm be the fellies of your wheels, steady your horses and your cars, And may your reins be fashioned well.

column1: accha vada tanā girā jarāyai brahmaṇaḥ patim agnim mitram na darśatam
column2: Invite thou hither with this song, for praise, Agni the Lord of Prayer, Him who is fair as Mitra is.

column1: mimīhi ślokam āsye parjanyaḥ iva tatanaḥ gāya gāyatram ukthyam
column2: Form in thy mouth the hymn of praise expand thee like, a rainy cloud Sing forth the measured eulogy.

column1: vandasva mārutam gaṇam tveṣam panasyum arkiṇam asme iti vr̥ddhāḥ asan iha
column2: Sing glory to the Marut host, praiseworthy, tuneful, vigorous: Here let the Strong Ones dwell with us.

column1: pra yat itthā parāvataḥ śociḥ na mānam asyatha kasya kratvā marutaḥ kasya varpasā kam yātha kam ha dhūtayaḥ
column2: WHEN thus, like flame, from far away, Maruts, ye cast your measure forth, To whom go Ye, to whom, O shakers of the earth, moved by whose wisdom, whose design?

column1: sthirā vaḥ santu āyudhā parānude vīl̥u uta prati skabhe yuṣmākam astu taviṣī panīyasī mā martyasya māyinaḥ
column2: Strong let your weapons be to drive away your foes, firm for resistance let them be. Yea, passing glorious must be your warrior might, not as a guileful mortal's strength.

column1: parā ha yat sthiram hatha naraḥ vartayatha guru vi yāthana vaninaḥ pr̥thivyāḥ vi āśāḥ parvatānām
column2: When what is strong ye overthrow, and whirl about each ponderous thing, Heroes, your course is through the forest trees of earth, and through the fissures of the rocks.

column1: nahi vaḥ śatruḥ vivide adhi dyavi na bhūmyām riśādasaḥ yuṣmākam astu taviṣī tanā yujā rudrāsaḥ nu cit ādhr̥ṣe
column2: Consumers of your foes, no enemy of yours is found in heaven or on the earth: Ye Rudras, may the strength, held in this bond, be yours, to bid defiance even now.

column1: pra vepayanti parvatān vi viñcanti vanaspatīn pro iti ārata marutaḥ durmadāḥ iva devāsaḥ sarvayā viśā
column2: They make the mountains rock and reel, they rend the forest-kings apart. onward, ye Maruts, drive, like creatures drunk with wine, ye, Gods with all your company.

column1: upo iti ratheṣu pr̥ṣatīḥ ayugdhvam praṣṭiḥ vahati rohitaḥ ā vaḥ yāmāya pr̥thivī cit aśrot abībhayanta mānuṣāḥ
column2: Ye to your chariot have yoked the spotted deer: a red deer, as a leader, draws. Even the Earth herself listened as ye came near, and men were sorely terrified.

column1: ā vaḥ makṣu tanāya kam rudrāḥ avaḥ vr̥ṇīmahe ganta nūnam naḥ avas yathā purā itthā kaṇvāya bibhyuṣe
column2: O Rudras, quickly we desire your succour for this work of ours. Come to us with your aid as in the days of old, so now for frightened Kaṇva's sake.

column1: yuṣmāiṣitaḥ marutaḥ martya iṣitaḥ ā yaḥ naḥ abhvaḥ īṣate vi tam yuyota śavasā vi ojasā vi yuṣmākābhiḥ ūti bhiḥ
column2: Should any monstrous foe, O Maruts, sent by you or sent by mortals threaten us, Tear ye him from us with your power and with your might, and with the succours that are yours.

column1: asāmi hi pra yajyavaḥ kaṇvam dr̥ pra cetasaḥ asāmi bhiḥ marutaḥ ā naḥ ūti bhiḥ ganta vr̥ṣṭim na vi dyutaḥ
column2: For ye, the worshipful and wise, have guarded Kaṇva perfectly. O Maruts, come to us with full protecting help, as lightning flashes seek the rain.

column1: asāmi ojaḥ bibhr̥tha su dānavaḥ asāmi dhūtayaḥ śavaḥ r̥ṣi dviṣe marutaḥ pari manyave iṣum na sr̥jata dviṣam
column2: Whole strength have ye, O Bounteous Ones; perfect, earth-shakers, is your might. Maruts, against the poet's wrathful enemy send ye an enemy like a dart.

column1: ut tiṣṭha brahmaṇaḥ pate deva yantaḥ tvā īmahe upa pra yantu marutaḥ su dānavaḥ indra prāsūḥ bhava sacā
column2: O BRAMANASPATI, stand up: God-serving men we pray to thee. May they who give good gifts, the Maruts, come to us. Indra, most swift, be thou with them.

column1: tvām it hi sahasaḥ putra martyaḥ upa brūte dhane hite su vīryam marutaḥ ā su aśvyam dadhīta yaḥ vaḥ ācakre
column2: O Son of Strength, each mortal calls to thee for aid when spoil of battle waits for him. O Maruts, may this man who loves you well obtain wealth of good steeds and hero might.

column1: pra etu brahmaṇaḥ patiḥ pra devī etu sūnr̥tā accha vīram naryam paṅkti rādhasam devāḥ yajñam nayantu naḥ
column2: May Brahmaṇaspati draw nigh, may Sunrta the Goddess come, And Gods bring to this rite which gives the five-fold gift the Hero, lover of mankind.

column1: yaḥ vāghate dadāti sūnaram vasu saḥ dhatte akṣiti śravaḥ tasmai il̥ām su vīrām ā yajāmahe su pratūrtim anehasam
column2: He who bestows a noble guerdon on the priest wins fame that never shall decay. For him we offer sacred hero-giving food, peerless and conquering easily.

column1: pra nūnam brahmaṇaḥ patiḥ mantram vadati ukthyam yasmin indraḥ varuṇaḥ mitraḥ aryamā devāḥ okāṁsi cakrire
column2: Now Brahmaṇaspati speaks forth aloud the solemn hymn of praise, Wherein Indra and Varuṇa, Mitra, Aryaman, the Gods, have made their dwelling place.

column1: tam it vocema vidatheṣu śambhuvam mantram devāḥ anehasam imām ca vācam prati haryatha naraḥ viśvā it vāmā vaḥ aśnavat
column2: May we in holy synods, Gods! recite that hymn, peerless, that brings felicity. If you, O Heroes, graciously accept this word, may it obtain all bliss from you.

column1: kaḥ deva yantam aśnavat janam kaḥ vr̥kta barhiṣam pra pra dāśvān pastyābhiḥ asthita antaḥ vāvat kṣayam dadhe
column2: Who shall approach the pious? who the man whose sacred grass is trimmed? The offerer with his folk advances more and more: he fills his house with precious things.

column1: upa kṣatram pr̥ñcīta hanti rāja bhiḥ bhaye cit su kṣitim dadhe na asya vartā na tarutā mahādhane na arbhe asti vajriṇaḥ
column2: He amplifies his lordly might, with kings he slays: e'en mid alarms he dwells secure In great or lesser fight none checks him, none subdues,– the wielder of the thunderbolt.

column1: yam rakṣanti pra cetasaḥ varuṇaḥ mitraḥ aryamā nu cit saḥ dabhyate janaḥ
column2: NE'ER is he injured whom the Gods Varuṇa, Mitra, Aryaman, The excellently wise, protect.

column1: yam bāhutāiva piprati pānti martyam riṣaḥ ariṣṭaḥ sarvaḥ edhate
column2: He prospers ever, free from scathe, whom they, as with full hands, enrich, Whom they preserve from every foe.

column1: vi duḥ gā vi dviṣaḥ puraḥ ghnanti rājānaḥ eṣām nayanti duḥ itā tiraḥ
column2: The Kings drive far away from him his troubles and his enemies, And lead him safely o'er distress.

column1: su gaḥ panthā anr̥kṣaraḥ ādityāsaḥ r̥tam yate na atra ava khādaḥ asti vaḥ
column2: Thornless, Âdityas, is the path, easy for him who seeks the Law: With him is naught to anger you.

column1: yam yajñam nayatha naraḥ ādityāḥ r̥junā pathā pra vaḥ saḥ dhītaye naśat
column2: What sacrifice, Âdityas, ye Heroes guide by the path direct,– May that come nigh unto your thought.

column1: saḥ ratnam martyaḥ vasu viśvam tokam uta tmanā accha gacchati astr̥taḥ
column2: That mortal, ever unsubdued, gains wealth and every precious thing, And children also of his own.

column1: kathā rādhāma sakhāyaḥ stomam mitrasya aryamṇaḥ mahi psaraḥ varuṇasya
column2: How, my friends, shall we prepare Aryaman's and Mitra's laud, Glorious food of Varuṇa?

column1: mā vaḥ ghnantam mā śapantam prati voce deva yantam sumnaiḥ it vaḥ ā vivāse
column2: I point not out to you a man who strikes the pious, or reviles: Only with hymns I call you nigh.

column1: caturaḥ cit dadamānāt bibhīyāt ā ni dhātoḥ na duḥ uktāya spr̥hayet
column2: Let him not love to speak ill words: but fear the One who holds all four Within his hand, until they fall.

column1: sam pūṣan adhvanaḥ tira vi aṁhaḥ vi mucaḥ napāt sakṣva deva pra naḥ puraḥ
column2: SHORTEN our ways, O Pûshan, move aside obstruction in the path: Go close before us, cloud-born God.

column1: yaḥ naḥ pūṣan aghaḥ vr̥kaḥ duḥśeva ādideśati apa sma tam pathaḥ jahi
column2: Drive, Pûshan, from our road the wolf, the wicked inauspicious wolf, Who lies in Wait to injure us.
